title: bst->list
description: Write a function `bst->list` that takes a binary search tree and returns a list of all values in the tree in sorted order (inorder traversal).

examples.explanation: Single node tree produces list with that value

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (bst->list t))

(bst->list empty)
(bst->list (make-node empty empty 5))
(bst->list (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (bst->list (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5)) (list 1 2 3 5 6 7 8))
(check-expect (bst->list (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 15) 12) 10)) (list 1 3 7 10 12 15))
(check-expect (bst->list (make-node empty (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 13) empty 17) (make-node empty empty 25) 20) 15)) (list 15 13 17 20 25))

(check-expect (bst->list (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 4) empty 6) empty 9) (make-node (make-node empty empty 14) (make-node empty empty 18) 16) 12)) (list 1 4 6 9 12 14 16 18))
